translation:

"privacy? what's that? ðŸ¤” i thought our personal data was public domain for facebook, amazon, google & co. ðŸ˜… every day our personal information is used for their profits. #dataprotection #privacy #notodatamining"

this post critiques the current state of data privacy and how companies like facebook, amazon, and google use personal information for their own gain without proper consent or regard for individuals' privacy. the hashtags #datenschutz (data protection) and #privatsphÃ¤re (privacy) show that the user is advocating for stronger protections and regulations regarding personal data. the last hashtag, #neinzudatamining (no to data mining), emphasizes their opposition to the practice of extracting and analyzing large amounts of personal data without consent.
